intro: Quararibea stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leafed quina, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain seeds covered in a sticky, resinous substance. It is often found growing in moist, shaded environments within the dense canopy of the rainforest. Due to its unique botanical features, it plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its habitat.
